Photo of Cantina Laredo - London, United Kingdom. Apple pie with sizzling butterscotch brandy
Photo of Cantina Laredo - London, United Kingdom. Churros

xadnNBNYVtKGljU0kJtOBA.text: My husband, friend and I had an overall very pleasant experience here Friday night. First of all, the aroma of delicious Mexican food hits you when you enter which is always a good sign. We had to wait about 20 minutes for a table but NBD in the end.I got the chile en nogada (vegetarian) which was quite good- a bit of spice was a great addition to the mixed veggies in the creamy sauce. I highly recommend this dish. Also the avocado martini was perfect! My husband love his carne tacos but the patatas side dish it accompanies was terrible. The spice on top is just.... blech. My husband said it tasted fishy. We sent it back and the waitress kindly removed it from the bill. I got the asparagus in its place which was lovely. We shared the chocolate brownie with walnuts but my friend became alarmed when he bit into a shell. This time the manager came over to apologise and again, he removed the item from the bill.The service overall was much better than I typically experience at London establishments. The prices were fair.

fbqIKzxkD779nuqVOkWfZQ.text: Pushy and unhelpful service, overpriced, variable quality food -- some amazing, some underwhelming.Had a strange experience with the service.  The waiter was pushy in saying that we should order more and more things, without listening to our preferences.  'Are you sure you don't want a small plate too?'  'You should also order rice.'  (We don't want rice.)  'Here this rice dish is good.'  'Want a drink?' (No.) 'Our margaritas are made with fresh ingredients.' .... Made the whole experience feel like we were listening to a salesman.Anyways the guacamole small dish (prepared at the table side) was very tasty, as was the vegetarian burrito.  The veggie fajitas were forgettable, especially as the guacamole offered with that was no good.  Strange to have such variable quality of the same thing on the table!  Overall, for the quality of food, it was definitely overpriced.  They do some margarita specials (2 for 1) on Wednesday and Saturday ... probably best to come just for those and grab some table side guac.  Leave the rest for one of the other Mexican restaurants around town.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina Laredo - London, United Kingdom. vegetarian burrito
Photo of Cantina Laredo - London, United Kingdom. tableside-prepared guacamole with nachos
Photo of Cantina Laredo - London, United Kingdom. veggie fajitas

3M2TiZEEqPJ7aTJXgdiYWw.text: I went to this restaurant last night to meet up with a bunch of classmates for a birthday!I was really surprised because as I was walking towards the restaurant there was LIVE MARIACHI music! SUPER COOL...walking in the ambiance was nice. It's on the higher end of the Mexican Food spectrum. This is a pricey place, but the appetizers all looked pretty delicious. I ordered the ceviche, but I was extremely disappointed with the portion sizes. It was tiny! The presentation was beautiful but it was SO SMALL.  Service was pretty good, but when paying for the bill, the server wanted everyone to pay with card to make it easier. Also, she have me the incorrect change, I didn't want to deal with that fiasco so I didn't complain. I might come here again, but then again, the food didn't blow me away plus price wise, I'm not sure if it is worth it. Especially when I'm from Southern California and the MEXICAN FOOD THERE IS AMAZING!

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina Laredo - London, United Kingdom. Live mariachi music!!!
Photo of Cantina Laredo - London, United Kingdom. Ceviche!!!

kwqudYM_-eQHhBJWM571Uw.text: Hmm, so I have to admit id heard many, many good things about this place and so was super excited to check it out. When I went there, they had no tables and we had to wait for almost half hour which at 7pm in an evening, I can understand. My and my friend rather awkwardly sat at the cramped bar while we waited, drinking a cocktail each. He ordered an avocado one, which he assured me tasted nothing like avocado at all and I ordered a fruity drink, which was nice but didn't blow my socks off.When we finally got a table, we browsed the menu for a while before deciding to order. I opted for the chicken stuffed with prawns and he went for the salad. My chicken was amazing but was just that!! A chicken breast on the plate with no sides. Luckily I had opted for a side of rice, so I meant I wasn't leaving hungry but at almost 15 pounds for this, I thought it was a tad overpriced. The salad was enormous and with chicken came to around 10 pounds and so I thought it was a far better dish for a main course. We did get a side of guacamole, but not the demonstration, as I watched at the table beside me and whilst it was good, I didn't think it warranted double the price to see.All in all, the meal was just ok and came to almost 75 pounds for a main each and a few drinks. If you want Mexican, I think you'd have far better food if you tried chilangos or chipotle and save a hella lotta money.

fUOZ_G0GqvDeQOKGF7XHTw.text: Finally found a place that does very good Mexican food.I recommend get the gucamole en molcajete - they make the gucamole in front of you and it is to die for!For my mains I got camaron poblano asada - grilled stake rapped around stuffed pepper, tiger prawns and some other stuff. The waiters where very nice and friendly and the drinks where made very well.Definitely a place to go in London if your craving some good Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina Laredo - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Cantina Laredo - London, United Kingdom. Camaron poblano asada

KLfRxmsDqqOTlSrhncSWcA.text: It should be noted that I am an EXPAT from Texas. Cantina Laredo was one of my favourite places in Dallas and I was thrilled to see them open in London. But... I wasn't sure if it would be the same. It was fantastic and brought back many memories of home. The salsa was authentic and great and the margaritas were equally as impressive. For my main I had Pork Tamales. Absolute fantastic. The flavours were great and very much what I expected as one who grew up on TexMex. If your are a Brit looking for a taste of Texas, this is it. If your are a Texan visiting London, this is a little slice of home.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina Laredo - London, United Kingdom. Pork Tamales, rice and beans.

URDl5hxBx9tTGvXZilx_WA.text: I really wanted to start this review as follows: Don't be misled by the 1990's office decor, the food in this restaurant is fantastic! Unfortunately much like the interior design the food and the service we had was pretty average. I eat a fair bit of Mexican food and found meals from places such as Poncho 8 and Chilango were superior to the salad and enchilada that we ate. The service was OK but it felt very much like a chain restaurant despite the fact it isn't from what I can see.  Admittedly we visited on a Monday evening so maybe we caught them on a quiet night as it seems most reviews are positive.

kXEi2siwZ8e0MIM1V6HNPA.text: A warm welcome awaits you, slip away from the crowds of Covent Garden into a modern and delicious experience.  This is a really good Mexican place -- a little nicer than most and generally worth the price.Staff is very attentive, which I find a nice change from a lot of eateries in this area. Cocktails are great: I've been here a few times and have always been pleased with the freshest ingredients mixed to quench your thirst. I highly recommend the guacamole starter -- they make it at the table in front of you.  The vegetable enchiladas were perfectly done, not too much cheese, and vegetables still holding a bit of firmness. My friend had an enchilada or burrito with a chocolate laced sauce which she said was divine. Desserts ....oh to salivate thinking of them.....I've uploaded a picture of the sizzling brownie & ice cream.  The only thing that lets this place down are the value of the side dishes, as the price is a bit high (£3.50) for small sides of rice or vegetables.  However that's a bit of a blip, don't let it stop you from visiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Cantina Laredo - London, United Kingdom. Brownie & ice cream dessert, served on a hot plate surrounded by sizzling cream

Cy2BWE9nXCqHVkGc7K9h1w.text: The food is actually pretty tasty, but portion sizes are small and in my opinion it's overpriced. The guacamole is freshly made at the table, and although it was good I was expecting a bit more for almost £8! Likewise, the main courses were quite small and didn't come with sides - these need to be ordered separately. The service was also slow and patchy when we ate here, and the waiting staff weren't particularly friendly.
